column4: Greetings, I have to understand the *nix world. What is GNU? And I'm not talking about the licence. I'm talking about the site gnu.org. And I know its not Unix, but why is it about it?

Here's the short version: Unix was an operating system with a lot of great tools, but the folks who owned it wouldn't make it "free" - free as in speech, not as in beer.  People couldn't hack on it and change it to their liking.
So, an enteprising fella in the 80's decided to make a carbon copy of Unix, but free
He called it GNU.  It used to stand for something that actually meant something ( I think), but now it's just GNU is Not Unix, because it is free!
No idea.  I was under the impression that the BSDs weren't linux.
don't worry - cruise control for col.
Is it right to say "Linux is made in C, because the kernel is in C?"
That sounds like more of an opinion thing.  I mean, sure, the kernel is in C, but I"m sur ethere are modules coded in C++.
Man, how hardcore would it be if someone started with JUST the kernel and built a distro from scratch, just to use on their own, not to actually distribute?
I'm actually asking theoritical questions, I'm really happy with the current distributions :P
I just want to get some basic things.
wtf are modules. I know how to load them (fglrx, vesa etc) but wtf are they?
You know, I'm honestly not sure
